items.title: Software
items.content_html:
I want to add a document to track links to websites, applications, tools, and some interesting stuff I will come across üòâ.

Code editors & IDE

Visual Studio Code - Probably one of the best all-in-one code editors. 10/10
Visual Studio - Same but different IDE. Used mainly for C# and C++. 7/10

Notes & Workflow

Obsidian - Notekeeping and work management. Lots of addons. 9/10
Notion - To-Do, management, organizing. We use it to manage Esteris 9/10

AI

HuggingFace - Use AI applications for free. Download models and programs. 10/10
StabilityMatrix - Automatic installer and manager for self-hosted AI image models and tools. 10/10
Suno AI - AI-powered voice assistant for developers. Provides natural language understanding and voice command capabilities. 9/10

Okada VC - Real-time AI voice changer using RVC models. Cuda / CPU 10/10
Applio - Program for training your own model. Also used for AI song covers. With features like overtraining detection 10/10
OpenAI - ChatGPT, SoRa, and DALL‚Ä¢E as we all know it. 9/10
A1111 - Stable Diffusion web UI, also included in StabilityMatrix 8/10
UVR3 - Ultimate Vocal Remover, I personally use it in combination with Applio and the results are Amazing 10/10

Network Tools

Curl - Command-line tool for making HTTP requests. Often used by me to see content of site from cli. 8/10
ngrok - Useful for testing webhooks and local development. I used it in now outdated project: Tunnel bot 9/10
Wireshark - View packets and analyze network traffic. 10/10
Angry IP Scanner - Great program for searching local devices. E.g., RPI. 7/10
Nmap - Network exploration and security analyzing tool. Often used to look for vulnerabilities. 10/10

Office

LibreOffice - Free and open-source office apps. Preinstalled on Ubuntu 7/10
Office 365 - Cloud-based subscription service provided by Microsoft. Includes popular applications like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. 9/10

Note: Obsidian and Notion are amazing Word alternatives.

Image Editing

Adobe Photoshop - Photoshop, just photoshop. I love every single function and use it a lot. Also I really like its AI 9/10
Adobe Lightroom - Photo editing and organizing software. I use it for its image refining. And management of the photos. 8/10
GIMP - Free and open-source image editing software. I prefer Photoshop. 7/10

items.title: Stability Matrix
items.content_html:
Intro üëã

Hi there again! I promised some cover of the AI so I will start with the probably easiest way to start using text to image or even video to image. But that is getting ahead of ourselves. Let‚Äôs begin then!

Installation ‚úÖ

First of all, we need to make sure that we meet the Minimal requirements:

Note that this might be different depending on the model used.Also, I adjusted it based on my experience. AMD might not work.

  • GPU: Nvidia, AMD (5GB+)
  • RAM: 12GB+
  • SSD: 20GB of free space (Also depending on the models used. HDD possible)

Next up is downloading the Stability Matrix app.
This is available here:Official website or you might prefer Github

Okay, the installation is pretty straight forward. The app should just launch.The next step is to install our interface and also the models we want to use.Specify your installation folder for the models and for the Stability Matrix itself.

Next up,

Models and Packages üñºÔ∏è

After the installation we will need to add package. As you can see on the picture I have 3 installed. You should be good with just one. And that will be ComfyUI.This is probably one of the best to start on. Or even for little bit advanced users.

Now models, there is plenty to choose from. Either HuggingFace or CivitAI.

Note for CivitAI you need an API key to download the models from the APP. (It is FREE)

My most used ones are:

  • Pony Realism by ZyloO
  • Airtist Realistic XL by CAIrtist
  • Realistic Vision V6 B1 by SG_161222

Once everything is installed and ready. Get into creating!

UI and Inference üë®‚Äçüíª

There are more ways of using and generating the images.You could use the classic Web UI or you can simply do it in the app itself.It is in the section called Inference. The ComfyUI is needed for this to work.

Thats it! üòú

I will be covering more of this topic soon. These are only the most basic things you could use Stability Matrix for. Videos, image to image and more are also possible.Have fun with parameters and models. Well and see you in the next one!

items.title: Usefull websites
items.content_html:
Usefull websites

Media editing

Remove.bg - I love this one, usefull for presentations when you need to remove background from image.
EZGIF - A great website for creating and editing GIFs easily.
Canva - A popular online graphic design tool with a wide range of templates and editing features.
Pixlr - An online photo editor with a user-friendly interface and various editing tools.
Fotor - A comprehensive online photo editing and graphic design tool.
BeFunky - An all-in-one creative platform for photo editing, graphic design, and collage making.
FotoFlexer - An easy-to-use online photo editor with basic editing features and special effects.

Network

MX Toolbox - A useful website for checking DNS records, blacklists, and other network-related information.
IPVoid - Provides various tools for IP address analysis, including blacklist check, IP geolocation, and reverse DNS lookup.
Shodan - A search engine for Internet-connected devices, allowing you to find specific types of devices and explore their vulnerabilities.
Wireshark - A powerful network protocol analyzer for capturing and analyzing network traffic.
Nmap - A versatile network scanning tool used for network exploration and security auditing.
Netcat - A command-line utility for reading from and writing to network connections using TCP or UDP.
ngrok - A secure tunneling service that allows you to expose your local development server to the internet.
Packet Tracer - A network simulation tool used for teaching and learning computer networking concepts.
OpenVAS - An open-source vulnerability scanner used for detecting security issues in computer systems and networks.
Speedtest - A popular website for testing your internet connection speed.
WhatIsMyIP - A website that displays your public IP address and provides information about your internet connection.
DownDetector - A website that tracks and reports outages and service disruptions for various online services.

AI

DeepL - An AI-powered translation tool that provides high-quality translations for various languages.
OpenAI - A research organization that develops and promotes AI technologies, including the famous GPT-3 language model.
Hugging Face - A platform that provides pre-trained models and libraries for natural language processing tasks, such as text generation and sentiment analysis.
Clarifai - An AI platform that offers image and video recognition capabilities, allowing developers to build applications with visual understanding.
Suno AI - Music generating AI. Can also create vocals. Allows you to make a song from a story or a character.

Fun

We are Jamming - Funny website to troll your friends with. Shows all information the browser could gather in a video cartoon clip.

Hey, I‚Äôm Wrexik

You can usually catch me around 7AM ‚òÄÔ∏è - 1AM üåô. Yeah, there is so much to see each day.My favorite activities are exploring internet, coding, gaming and streaming.IT is not my only interest, I also like to *read* maybe not that but I love riding bikes üö≤.Whether it‚Äôs downhill or urban, it‚Äôs mine üíñ.

What to expect?

  • Sharing experience
  • Things I got to know recently
  • Class notes
  • What I‚Äôm up to

Recommended reading

Stability Matrix Software

But why?

I just love markdown and the idea of keeping things around :)
and I want to try something new!

This is only the begining :)

items.title: Operating systems
items.content_html:
Flashing

Rufus - Tool for creating bootable USB drives. With functions for customizing Windows installations. 10/10
Raspberry imager - Official RPI software for not only RPI devices. I like to use it for setting up things quickly. 10/10

Systems

Windows 11 - Classic Windows with new design and features. I personally like it üòú. 9/10
Windows 10 - Previous version of Windows and still the most used. 9/10
Kali Linux - Linux distribution for ethical hacking and pen testing. 10/10
Parrot OS - Same as Kali Linux but also focused on development. I like it a little more than Kali for its pre-installed tools. 10/10
Ubuntu - Simple and beginner-friendly Linux distro. I personally run it next to Windows for development and server management. 10/10
Red Hat Enterprise Linux - Enterprise-grade Linux distribution with long-term support. I have no experience with this distro. 9/10
Arch Linux - Lightweight and highly customizable Linux distribution. I havent tried it yet. 8/10

Customization

Windows

TranslucentTB - Makes your taskbar transparent in Windows 11 / 10. Love it üíñ. 10/10
Rainmeter - Adds ability to have widgets and useful things on your desktop. 8/10
Start 11 - Windows 11 app that returns the old start menu. But it is paid. 10/10

Linux

Conky - Widgets and system monitor. Usefull for easy customization. 9/10
Grub Customizer - Graphical interface to customize the GRUB bootloader settings and messages. And also select the perfered OS. 8/10

items.title: My PC
items.content_html:
The beginning ‚òÄÔ∏è

So this all started when I was like 10. And man, those times. With my friends we were used to play on just everything. I had an old Asus ROG laptop, you may see ROG that shouldn‚Äôt be that bad. Minecraft 1.13 just dropped, and with it so did my FPS. I went from 30 to 15 üìâ. Running Windows 7 and a huge 4GB of RAM ‚öñÔ∏è.
At that time I also got into coding and scripting üë®‚Äçüíª. And I was in need of a new computer. Got the new computer and it lasted with me for around 3 years. And again I was in need of something BIG that would meet all my needs! Yea, I started saving and after a long wait of 6 months or 15759360 seconds ‚è±Ô∏è of counting and ahhh There it is üòé!

The Build üß≠

  • CPU: i9 12900k 16 cores - clocked to 5,3 Ghz
  • GPU: Asus ROG Strix 4070ti OC
  • RAM: Corsair Vengeance 32GB DDR4 RGB RT white - clocked to 4000 MT/s
  • Motherboard: Asus Z690 TUF Gaming Plus
  • PSU: Cooler Master V850 GOLD V2 White
  • AIO: Corsair Capelix elite h115i
  • Case: Lian-li Air Mini

Things weren‚Äôt that smooth tho üòÇ:

The case in the configuration is well not ideal. Originally, my first case for this build was the H510 from NZXT. But due to my GPU clearance between the GPU and the AIO being the size of a sheet of paper and not able to close the side panel because of the cable, I had to get a new one


So yeah‚Ä¶ Next, I got a brand new and shiny O11 Air Mini and yet again another complication. But I calculated that one, I wasn‚Äôt the only one with this problem. And I did know this before buying the new case. The AIO wouldn‚Äôt fit.


And this was pretty easy, but impossible without this video, love you dude :D.

And this is it!
